title: HC Line of Fire Volume One 04of12 Monte Cassino XviD AC3
description:
Line of Fire Volume One

War Documentary hosted by John Viner and Mike Leighton, published by History Channel in 2002 - English narration

Information
------------------------------

Line Of Fire is history with a difference. The great battlefields of war are presented in a unique animated environment providing new insights into military history's most compelling events. Each powerful episode combines informative graphics with atmospheric recreations and archive footage to analyse every facet of famous battles from the medieval period to modern times. Series also features authoritative comment by leading military historians from the Royal Military Academy, Sandhurst.

A Cromwell Production in association with The History Channel UK

4)  Monte Cassino 
During 1944, the Allies tried desperately to break through the German winter defensive line that blocked the advance to Rome. At the centre of the line was the heavily fortified town of Cassino, which was dominated by a sixth century Benedictine monastery. This imposing hilltop site became the subject of bitter controversy and a symbol of some of the most savage fighting of World War Two.
